<title
    level="1"
    right="Feat 1"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Crane Stance](/Feats.aspx?ID=5976) <actions string="Single Action" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Monk" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=656" />
<trait label="Stance" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=701" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Player Core 2](/Sources.aspx?ID=227) pg. 118 <sup>1.1</sup>

**Archetypes** [Martial Artist](/Archetypes.aspx?ID=67) (Level 4), [Wild Mimic](/Archetypes.aspx?ID=226) (Level 4), [Martial Artist](/Archetypes.aspx?ID=255) (Level 4)

**Requirements**
You are unarmored.

</column>

---

Your arms flutter like a crane's wings. You gain a +1 circumstance bonus to AC, but the only Strikes you can make are crane wing attacks. These deal 1d6 bludgeoning damage; are in the [brawling](/WeaponGroups.aspx?ID=4) group; and have the [agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=526), [finesse](/Traits.aspx?ID=602), [nonlethal](/Traits.aspx?ID=661), and [unarmed](/Traits.aspx?ID=719) traits.

 While in Crane Stance, reduce the DC for [High Jump](/Actions.aspx?ID=2377) and [Long Jump](/Actions.aspx?ID=2378) by 5, and when you [Leap](/Actions.aspx?ID=2298), you can move an additional 5 feet horizontally or 2 feet vertically.

<title level="2">Crane Stance leads to...</title>
[Crane Flutter](/Feats.aspx?ID=6000)
name: Crane Stance
